q1.text: You just graduated! üéì Your relatives hand you ‚Ç¨100 as a gift. Your friends spam your phone: ‚ÄúBROOO we‚Äôre going OUT tonight üçæ‚ú®‚Äù.

options.consequence: You buy drinks for everyone and attempt to crowd surf in a bar with 7 people. You wake up missing a shoe and dignity.
You grab a burger and chill in the park. Ducks enjoy your fries. Vibes immaculate.
Your friends call you boring, but you feel powerful like a spreadsheet magician.

q2.text: Morning hits. Your bank balance punches harder than your hangover. You need income.

options.text: Apply for a fast food job.
options.consequence: They hire you instantly. Either you‚Äôre qualified or they‚Äôre desperate. Probably both.
You sell your ancient game console to a nostalgic collector who calls it ‚Äòretro tech treasure.‚Äô

options.text: Do nothing and hope life sorts itself out.
options.consequence: Life does NOT sort itself out. You just scroll TikTok for 6 hours straight.

q3.text: You avoided chaos so far. Safe start. What‚Äôs next?

options.consequence: You submit an application while wearing pajamas. Efficient.
You feel like Warren Buffett. In reality you gained absolutely nothing‚Ä¶ yet.

options.text: Buy something small as a reward.
options.consequence: You buy fancy bubble tea. It‚Äôs delicious. But now you‚Äôre broke in spirit and wallet.

q4.text: You start working and actually earning money. But work is exhausting.

options.text: Take extra shifts to earn more.
options.consequence: You smell permanently like frying oil, but the money rolls in.

options.text: Quit after one day. Too much effort.
options.consequence: You dramatically announce retirement from the workforce.

options.text: Buy a scooter to commute faster.
options.consequence: You find a used scooter online, questionable quality but shiny.

q5.text: You receive a notification: ‚ÄúInstant ‚Ç¨200 loan! 0% interest for 7 days!* (*Not really)‚Äù

options.consequence: That was suspiciously easy. The app‚Äôs mascot winks at you. Creepy.
You block notifications like a healthy adult.
You become a legend at the bar. You also become financially doomed.

q6.text: Your friend says: ‚ÄúBro trust me, this coin will 100x. Lambo in 2 weeks.‚Äù

options.consequence: You make the sound financial choice. Zero excitement. Zero stress.
You stare at fluctuating numbers like it‚Äôs life or death.
Boring but steady.

q7.text: Bills arrive: phone plan, bus pass, food. Adulting hits hard.

options.consequence: Boring but safe. Your inner accountant smiles.
Turns out prayer does not stop overdue fees.
They say yes. Friendship strained.
Engine dies in 3 minutes. You push it home. Passers-by laugh.

options.text: Use it to take extra shifts.
options.consequence: Zoom zoom, cash cash.
They laugh at your terrible acting. Denied.

q9.text: Loan repayment is due. Additional fees appear out of nowhere.

options.text: Take another loan to cover it.
options.consequence: Ah yes, the classic. Loan to pay loan. Genius plan.

options.text: Work more to pay it off.
options.consequence: Your manager is thrilled, you're slightly dead inside.
Debt collectors begin circling like financial vultures.

q10.text: PARTY MAYHEM. You wake up in a different city.

options.text: Try to figure out what happened.
options.consequence: You retrace steps and find a parking ticket taped to your forehead.
Stolen by a guy you arm-wrestled at 4am.
Millions laughing. You might monetize this...
The repair guy judges your cracked screen like a crime scene.
The salesperson hypnotizes you. You somehow buy the expensive model.
Welcome to caveman mode. Peaceful but inconvenient.

q12.text: Meme coin is moving wildly. Charts look like a rollercoaster from hell.

options.consequence: You lock in losses and cry softly.
Diamond hands engaged. You roll dice with fate.
Your gamble senses tingle. Not in a good way.

q13.text: Reality slap: your kitchen tap won‚Äôt stop dripping.

options.consequence: Painful swipe, peaceful sink.
Speedrun regret. The house thanks you.
Problem gone; future bill grows fangs.

q14.text: Friend asks about the loan you owe them.

options.consequence: Friendship level increases +1.
You now have both financial and social debt.
They absolutely do not believe you.

q15.text: You are drowning in loans. The abyss stares back.

options.consequence: You become a warning story schools use in economics class.
You owe them lifelong humiliation and chores.
You now own 3 shirts and a spoon, but restart possible.

q16.text: Debt collectors begin calling. You feel fear.

options.consequence: Adulting intensifies.
You are now a legend of financial failure.
Someone gives advice. Surprisingly helpful.

q17.text: Your chaotic TikTok video goes viral.

options.consequence: You make deals with questionable energy drink brands.
People moved on. You are yesterday‚Äôs meme.
Yikes. You get cancelled for something you don‚Äôt remember doing.

q18.text: You survived the chaos so far. What's your final move?

options.consequence: You resist temptation like a monk.
Safe steady growth. No fireworks.
Designer sunglasses that make you look rich but feel broke. Final splurge ends your run.
You become a peaceful forest monk.
Rebuild financially like a phoenix.
Your only possessions are a robe and a coconut.

options.text: Coin moons or fame skyrockets ‚Äî YOU WIN
options.consequence: Money rains. You buy a toaster made of gold. Financial miracle.
Your investment evaporates like tears in rain.

options.text: Sell early and secure some profit.
options.consequence: Smart move. You avoid disaster.

q23.text: You start a strict ‚ÄòSavings Challenge‚Äô month. Temptations appear daily.

options.consequence: You pack lunches, brew own coffee, ascend to frugal monk status.
One pastry won‚Äôt kill the budget‚Ä¶ probably.
Challenge forgotten; courier drivers learn your name.

q24.text: Your index fund wobbles mildly. Boring charts vs thrilling noise online.

options.consequence: You double down; future you nods approvingly.
You sprinkle into another fund. Portfolio feels balanced-ish.
Boredom defeated. Stress invited.

q25.text: Friends pitch a ‚Äòbudget‚Äô weekend trip that keeps inflating in scope.

options.consequence: You hostel hop and eat discount noodles.
Suite, fancy meals, spontaneous excursions. Wallet whimpers.
You grind while others post sunsets.

q26.text: Job review cycle. You consider your approach to a raise.

options.consequence: You present charts; manager impressed (and slightly scared).
Silence strategy yields‚Ä¶ exactly nothing.
Risky move; partial bump, mild tension.

q27.text: Tax letter arrives with confusing adjustments.

options.consequence: You absorb the hit and avoid penalties. Bureaucracy defeated.
Minor fee accrues while you ‚Äòresearch‚Äô.
Chaos triggered; auditors frown dramatically.

q29.text: Your modest celebration unlocked a wave of ‚Äòfree trial‚Äô emails. Subscriptions loom.

options.consequence: You purge the worst offenders before billing hits.
Auto-renew seeds planted. Wallet tension rises.

options.text: Add a fancy AI subscription too
options.consequence: Surely this one pays for itself. Surely.

q30.text: Streaming, gaming, niche newsletters ‚Äî all billing this week.

options.consequence: You spreadsheet the chaos and reclaim a bit of cash.
Your bank quietly bleeds.
Value feels like burning money faster.
You reduce churn but still feel subscription shackles.
Debt for digital perks. Bold.
You drift into recurring charge oblivion.

q32.text: Roommate is late on rent and dishes form geological layers.

options.consequence: They nod; maybe progress.
Humor applied. Effect uncertain.
You buy time at personal cost.

q33.text: Tension shifts. Outcome hinges on your follow-up.

options.consequence: Structure reduces friction.
Minor churn cost, cleaner restart.
You both flee. Financial reset messy.

q34.text: Resale momentum builds. Your room is half empty, listings active everywhere.

options.consequence: You skip junk; margins improve.
Cash spikes, mild existential regret.

options.text: Buy more random stuff to flip
options.consequence: Inventory risk returns immediately.

q35.text: Buyer messages flood in. Time management cracking.

options.consequence: Efficiency surge; micro-business vibes.
Ratings drop; stress rises.
Funds vanish into the void.

options.text: Label every fork with QR codes
options.consequence: Utensil tracking system impresses no one.
Gas fees for dish assignments. Brilliantly inefficient.
Breakfast becomes a punitive experience.
Graphs stun them into compliance.
Emotional but financially useless.
Rainbow Road decides rent split.
Discipline preserved.
Diversification or dilution?
Behavioral finance moment.
Detox from predatory UX.
Shiny badge, worse balance.
Internet gives 3 pity likes.
Clause requires weekly backflips.
You stand for principles; wallet sighs.
Boxes not designed yet but money appears.
You defeat marketing psychology.
It glows to remind you of regret.
You now own 12 unused courses.
